channel.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
channel.description:
Hello :)
I just installed Axoloti 1.0.12 on a Windows machine. SOrry I cant tell you the specific specifications cause I dont know where to find this on this machine right now. I will look for it an post it later..
But my problem is that I have installed Axoloti and copied the runtime folder to programs(86). Axoloti apps works, BUT I cant se the factory or the community library.
I followed the install instructions and I use same log in for github as on the other machine. BUt it seems like it wont connect. I looked in "documents" folder and there is no Axoloti folder, for the community and factory library. So it hasnt synced.
Any ideas how to get this working?
Jaffa

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

well google translates "Netværksstien blev ikke fundet" to network not found....

if its a work computer, it may be that your user profile is stored on the network, and this is causing issues?!

Read full topic
item.source: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

I get this when trying to sync libraries. I have also updated java. But it keeps saying something with java is going on.

java.io.FileNotFoundException: \Documents\axoloti\axoloti.prefs (Netværksstien blev ikke fundet)

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

when i do the reset all i get this message;

va.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:729)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.security.ProtectionDomain$JavaSecurityAccessImpl.doIntersectionPrivilege(ProtectionDomain.java:80)

Caused by: java.io.IOException: Creating directories for \Documents\axoloti\axoloti-contrib.git failed
at org.eclipse.jgit.util.FileUtils.mkdirs(FileUtils.java:370)
at org.eclipse.jgit.internal.storage.file.FileRepository.create(FileRepository.java:288)
at org.eclipse.jgit.api.InitCommand.call(InitCommand.java:115)
... 43 more

Maybe java is the issue. it is a work computer so i need ot check up on it if it has java.

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

I need the error from when it tried to create the libraries.
do a reset all, and then paste the entire console log here

edit: its going to also be important to know which version of windows your using etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Reload objects i get this:

search path : \Documents\axoloti\axoloti-factory\objects
search path : \Documents\axoloti\objects
search path : \Documents\axoloti\axoloti-contrib\objects
finished loading objects

Sync libraries:

sync repo FAILED cannot find submodule : community (1.0.12,anon)
search path : \Documents\axoloti\axoloti-factory\objects
search path : \Documents\axoloti\objects
search path : \Documents\axoloti\axoloti-contrib\objects
finished loading objects

I noticed that if I close Axoloti anbd open it again it has lost all the settings in preferences, like local libraries etc.

I see sync repo error, but I dont know how to fix that.

Read full topic
item.source: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!

item.title: Problems with seeing factory & community library on Windows!
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Need to see a log or something that gives us a hint to the problem.

Only suggestions
Check your network connection
Reset libraries - file/preferences/ reset all

Note: get it working without your contributor details first.

Read full topic
